properties.areaDesc: Newton, MO; Barton, MO; Cedar, MO; Cherokee, KS; St. Clair, MO; Jasper, MO; Dade, MO; Crawford, KS; Bourbon, KS; Vernon, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:58PM CST until January 11 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Bourbon County in southeastern Kansas...
Cherokee County in southeastern Kansas...
Crawford County in southeastern Kansas...
Barton County in southwestern Missouri...
Western Newton County in southwestern Missouri...
Western Cedar County in southwestern Missouri...
Vernon County in west central Missouri...
Western St. Clair County in west central Missouri...
Jasper County in southwestern Missouri...
Northwestern Dade County in southwestern Missouri...

* Until 700 AM CST Saturday.

* At 654 PM CST, Doppler Radar Estimates indicate that up to three
inches of rain have already fallen over southeast Kansas and
extreme western Missouri since early afternoon. This will lead
to slow rises of water and flooding along creeks and streams and
low lying areas.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the warning include...
Joplin...                         Pittsburg...
Carthage...                       Webb City...
Prairie State Park...             Nevada...
Fort Scott...                     Carl Junction...
Lamar...                          Baxter Springs...
El Dorado Springs...              Frontenac...
Columbus...                       Galena...
Girard...                         Oronogo...
Seneca...                         Carterville...
Duquesne...                       Arma...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
North Main and Murphy Boulevard In Joplin...
Route K at Dry Wood Creek east of Arcadia...
Route JJ at Center Creek southeast of Carl Junction...
Route CC at Lost Creek just south of Racine...
and Highway 126 at The Spring River 3 miles north of Jasper.

Additional rainfall amounts of up to an inch will be possible are
possible across the warned area through this evening.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.
